Articles.Content:
With few exceptions, all things have a beginning and an end.

This is my last post on KSP Forums.

Thank you to all of you who helped me to understand space travel better than I did when I arrived, and other science as well.

I have much to do, and I cannot do balance it between KSP and IRL successfully.

I have enjoyed this, but it has to end. For the greater good.

As a parting gift, I leave this music... which I quite like as it describes my feelings quite well.

 

One more thing... Vanamonde your an awesome moderator, and the way you run things is a model for how other sites should be run but all too often are not. Even when correcting posters, myself included.

Thanks to all the other moderators too.

 

Good-bye all!

It's been fun. Learned a lot.

 

 

Edited January 13, 2020 by Spacescifi
So long, and thanks for all the fishing (for ideas, that is)!
I hope you some day get the game (or KSP2) and come back whenever you're aching for some more conversation!
You're welcome as a silent post-er. I rarely post anything here anymore either, nor do I check it often. But you're welcome

Well... bye.

“Learning never exhausts the mind.”

Quote- Leonardo da Vinci

Meaning? Come maybe visit the forum once or twice, and learn more about rocket science? Idk

all the best 

Edited February 5, 2020 by WinkAllKerb''
